block.p: Hope Gates Stearns, a daughter of Mrs. Richard B. Stearns Jr. of New York and the late Mr. Stearns, was married yesterday to Paul David Moeller, a son of Dr. and Mrs. V. Richard Moeller of Waverly, Iowa. The Rev. George Busler, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Mark's Church in Westhampton Beach, N.Y.

Mrs. Moeller, 27, teaches at the Lincoln Elementary School in Iowa City. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree from the Bank Street College of Education. Her mother, Sharon Gates Stearns, works in the development office at the Brearley School in New York. Her father was a managing director of Security Capital Group, a real estate investment and management company in New York.

Hope Gates Stearns, a daughter of Mrs. Richard B. Stearns Jr. of New York and the late Mr. Stearns, was married yesterday to Paul David Moeller, a son of Dr. and Mrs. V. Richard Moeller of Waverly, Iowa. The Rev. George Busler, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Mark's Church in Westhampton Beach, N.Y.

Mrs. Moeller, 27, teaches at the Lincoln Elementary School in Iowa City. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree from the Bank Street College of Education. Her mother, Sharon Gates Stearns, works in the development office at the Brearley School in New York. Her father was a managing director of Security Capital Group, a real estate investment and management company in New York.

Mr. Moeller, 25, graduated from Wartburg College in Waverly and is a dental student at the University of Iowa. His mother, Linda Moeller, directs communications and marketing at Wartburg and is the chairwoman of the Waverly Area Development Group, a development organization and chamber of commerce. His father, a veterinarian, is a partner in the Waverly Veterinary Clinic.
